THERON_USE_BOOST_THREADS
THERON_USE_STD_THREADS
#define THERON_USE_STD_THREADS   0

Controls whether std threads, locks, etc are used.

If THERON_USE_BOOST_THREADS is defined as 0 and THERON_USE_STD_THREADS is defined as 1 then std threads are used, introducing a dependency on std::thread. If both THERON_USE_BOOST_THREADS and THERON_USE_STD_THREADS are defined as 0, Windows threads are used, introducing a dependency on the windows.h header.

Defaults to 0 (Windows threads or Boost threads).

The value of THERON_USE_STD_THREADS can be overridden by defining it globally in the build (in the makefile using -D, or in the project preprocessor settings in Visual Studio).

Note:
Support for std::thread is only available in C++11, so requires a C++11 compiler (for example GCC 4.6 or later).
